name: Egg Foo Yung with Mushroom Sauce
author: dakota kelly
summary: These egg and bean sprout pancakes are cooked in peanut oil, and bathed in mushroom sauce.
directions: Thinly slice green onion, and reserve 1 tablespoon of the top for garnish
Stir the remaining onion into the egg along with the bean sprouts and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce
Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot
For each pancake, drop 1/4 cup of egg mixture into the hot oil
Cook until the bottoms are set, 1 to 2 minutes, then turn over and continue cooking for another 1 to 2 minutes until cooked through
Transfer to a warm serving plate while you make the remaining pancakes
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in the skillet and cook the mushrooms with the remaining 2 tablespoons of soy sauce until the mushrooms are soft, about 3 minutes
Dissolve the cornstarch in the broth, stir into the mushrooms, and cook until thickened
To serve, pour the sauce over the egg foo yung pancakes, and sprinkle with the reserved onion
